text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Takahashi was born in Osaka Prefecture on April 11, 1976. After graduating from Nishiyama High School, she joined Nikko Securities Dream Ladies in 1995. The club won Nadeshiko League championship for 3 years in a row (1996-1998). However, the club was disbanded in 1998 due to financial strain. She moved to OKI FC Winds in 1999. However the club was disbanded end of 1999 season and she moved to Urawa Reinas FC (later Urawa Reds) in 2000. She was selected Best Eleven in 2004. She retired end of 2009 season.Urawa Reds On March 29, 2005, when Takahashi was 28 years old, she debuted for the Japan national team against Australia. She played 2 games for Japan in 2005. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2005 2 0 Total 2 0 ==References== Category:1976 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Osaka Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Nikko Securities Dream Ladies players Category:OKI FC Winds players Category:Urawa Red Diamonds Ladies players
title: Saiko Takahashi
